abstracts.cdata!:
The overall development objective of the
            Avian Influenza Control and Human Pandemic Preparedness and
            Response Project is to minimize the threat posed to humans
            and the poultry industry in Georgia by Highly Pathogenic
            Avian Influenza (HPAI) and other zoonoses in domestic
            poultry, and to prepare for, control, and respond to
            influenza pandemics and other infectious disease emergencies
            in humans.  The closing date for the will be extended from
            February 28, 2011 until June 30, 2011. The extension is
            necessary to allow additional time for remaining project
            activities to be completed. The project implementation has
            been slow due to some implementation delays, in part caused
            by recent staff turnover in the implementation units and
            procurement delays. During the last mission, the team agreed
            with the implementation units on a detailed action plan for
            the project. The Government has revised the project action
            plan to reflect an updated implementation schedule to
            complete project activities by June 30, 2011. The project
            team fully supports the request as the extension will
            provide the time needed to fully achieve project objectives.
            This will be the second extension of the project and will
            bring the total extension period to 22 months.
